title: Procurement overview
line1: Follow the steps below to create your procurement. Each stage can be saved and resumed at any time.
line2: You can download and save what you enter to your own system.
line4: Check the terms and conditions for this lot within the documents area of the MCF3 agreement page.

sections: Create and download a shortlist of suppliers, which will be applied to all pre-tender market engagement and call-off events in this project. Because suppliers in Lots 2 and 3 provide all services, they cannot be filtered.
You can access supplier rate cards through the filtering tool.

You can refine your needs by asking questions before formally publishing your requirements. You cannot run an Expression of Interest, Request for Information, Further Competition or Direct Award at the same time, in the same project.
You can do pre-tender market engagement in one of the following ways:
subsections: Find out if suppliers are interested in bidding for your project and can offer the products or services needed. If a supplier does not respond to an EoI, they cannot bid for the opportunity later.
Gather information for your project from suppliers about the products and services they offer.
If you are ready to write and publish your requirements you can go straight to the next step.

sections: Write and publish your bid pack for suppliers, who can then submit their responses to your requirements.
You will need a clear set of criteria that suppliers will need to meet and be evaluated against. You will also need to include how you will score their responses.
For the lot you selected, you can run your procurement in one of the following ways:
subsections: You will need to invite all suppliers that have been shortlisted using the supplier filtering tool to bid for your opportunity. You will need to evaluate all bids that are submitted.
If you find a single supplier who can meet your requirements, you can choose to award your contract directly.

sections: You must evaluate suppliers to find the one that best meets your requirements.
You should use the methods and criteria you published with your requirements to assess and score suppliers.
You can now award a contract to the successful supplier.
You will need to give feedback to the successful supplier as well as all unsuccessful suppliers.
You need to publish the contract on Contracts Finder. This is a legal requirement.

content.text: Digital Specialists and Programmes, Lot 2: Specialists
